results.title: Simvastatin Upregulates Lipoxin A4 and Accelerates Neuroinflammation Resolution After Intracerebral Hemorrhage
results.text_hl: Similar to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, exogenous LXA4 effectively promoted circulating PMN apoptosis in the early stage of @DISEASE_Cerebral_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D002543 @@@ICH@@@ and restricted the secondary @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@brain injury@@@ triggered by PMNs that infiltrated the brain.

citations.NLM: Zhang J, Hao N, Li W, Chen Q, Chen Z, Feng H, Wu Y, Shi X. Simvastatin Upregulates Lipoxin A4 and Accelerates Neuroinflammation Resolution After Intracerebral Hemorrhage Curr Neurovasc Res. 2022 Sep 13;():. PMID: 36100985
citations.BibTeX: @article{36100985, title={Simvastatin Upregulates Lipoxin A4 and Accelerates Neuroinflammation Resolution After Intracerebral Hemorrhage}, author={Zhang J and Hao N and Li W and Chen Q and Chen Z and Feng H and Wu Y and Shi X}, journal={Curr Neurovasc Res}}

results.title: Simvastatin preconditioning confers neuroprotection against hypoxia-ischemia induced brain damage in neonatal rats via autophagy and silent information regulator 1 (SIRT1) activation.
results.text_hl: Previous studies have shown that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Sim@@@) has neuroprotective effects in a neonatal model of @DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@-@DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ (@DISEASE_Hypoxia_Ischemia_Brain @DISEASE_MESH:D020925 @@@HI@@@)-induced @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@brain injury@@@ when administered before but not after @DISEASE_Hypoxia_Ischemia_Brain @DISEASE_MESH:D020925 @@@HI@@@, pointing to the preconditioning (PC)-like effects of the statin.

citations.NLM: Carloni S, Balduini W. Simvastatin preconditioning confers neuroprotection against hypoxia-ischemia induced brain damage in neonatal rats via autophagy and silent information regulator 1 (SIRT1) activation. Exp Neurol. 2020 Feb;324():113117. PMID: 31734315
citations.BibTeX: @article{31734315, title={Simvastatin preconditioning confers neuroprotection against hypoxia-ischemia induced brain damage in neonatal rats via autophagy and silent information regulator 1 (SIRT1) activation.}, author={Carloni S and Balduini W}, journal={Exp Neurol}, volume={324}, pages={113117}}

results.title: Combined Treatment with Hydrophilic and Lipophilic Statins Improves Neurological Outcomes Following Experimental Cardiac Arrest in Mice.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@Pravastatin@@@ was less potent than @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ at reducing @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@neuronal injury in the brain@@@.

citations.NLM: Nakayama S, Taguchi N, Isaka Y, Nakamura T, Tanaka M. Combined Treatment with Hydrophilic and Lipophilic Statins Improves Neurological Outcomes Following Experimental Cardiac Arrest in Mice. Neurocrit Care. 2020 Aug;33(1):64-72. PMID: 31591692

results.title: Reduction of ischemic brain injury in rats with normothermic and hyperthermic conditions.
results.text_hl: In this study they further examined whether treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ can reduce @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@ischemic brain injury@@@ in a hyperthermic condition.

results.title: Simvastatin reduced ischemic brain injury and perfusion deficits in an embolic model of stroke.
results.text_hl: The functional significance and neuroprotectiove mechanism of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatins@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@ischemic brain injury@@@ is controversial.

results.title: Role of autophagy in early brain injury after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats.
results.text_hl: Autophagy was further activated by @CHEMICAL_Sirolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020123 @@@rapamycin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, and apoptosis was inhibited and @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@EBI@@@ was ameliorated.

citations.NLM: Zhao H, Ji Z, Tang D, Yan C, Zhao W, Gao C. Role of autophagy in early brain injury after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats. Mol Biol Rep. 2013 Feb;40(2):819-27. PMID: 23054025

results.title: Simvastatin reduces secondary brain injury caused by cortical contusion in rats: possible involvement of TLR4/NF-kappaB pathway.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ reduces secondary @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@brain injury@@@ caused by @DISEASE_Brain_Contusion @DISEASE_MESH:D000070624 @@@cortical contusion@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@: possible involvement of @GENE_TLR4 @GENE_29260 @@@TLR4@@@/NF-kappaB pathway.

results.title: Simvastatin reduces vasospasm after aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: results of a pilot randomized clinical trial.
results.text_hl: We demonstrate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduces serum markers of @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@brain injury@@@ and attenuates @DISEASE_Vasospasm_Intracranial @DISEASE_MESH:D020301 @@@vasospasm@@@ after @DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@SAH@@@.

citations.NLM: Lynch JR, Wang H, McGirt MJ, Floyd J, Friedman AH, Coon AL, Blessing R, Alexander MJ, Graffagnino C, Warner DS, Laskowitz DT. Simvastatin reduces vasospasm after aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage: results of a pilot randomized clinical trial. Stroke. 2005 Sep;36(9):2024-6. PMID: 16051891
